    So you’re trying to choose an event-study estimator…

    event_study.Rmd

    Comparison Table

    There is certainly many more nuances to each estimator, hence this is a simplified version of the table.

    Event Study Estimators
    Estimator R package Type Comparison group Main Assumptions Covers use of pre-treatment covariates Uniform inference of estimates
    Gardner (2021)

    did2s

    		 Imputes Y(0) Not-yet- and Never-treated
    • Correct specification of Y(0)
    • Parallel Trends for all units
    • Limited anticipation*
    		✔
    Borusyak, Jaravel, and Spiess (2021)

    {didimputation}

    		 Imputes Y(0) Not-yet- and Never-treated
    • Correct specification of Y(0)
    • Parallel Trends for all units
    • Limited anticipation*
    		✔
    Callaway and Sant'Anna (2021)

    did

    		 2x2 Aggregation Either Not-yet- or Never-treated
    • Correct specification of evolution of Y(0) or Propensity Score
    • Parallel Trends for Not-yet- or Never-treated
    • Limited anticipation*
    		✔ ✔
    Roth and Sant'Anna (2021)

    {staggered}

    		 2x2 Aggregation Not-yet-treated
    • Treatment timing is random
    Sun and Abraham (2020)

    fixest

    		 Interacted TWFE Not-yet- and Never-treated
    • Parallel Trends for all units
    • Limited anticipation*
    * Anticipation can be accounted for by adjusting 'initial treatment day' back (x) number of years, where (x) is the number of years before treatment that anticipation can occur.

    ** Misclassifications are my own fault.
